WHO has issued a Statement on Tobacco use and COVID-19. Tobacco smoking is a known risk factor for
many respiratory infections and increases the severity of respiratory diseases. A review of studies by
public health experts convened by WHO found that smokers are more likely to develop severe disease
with COVID-19, compared to non-smokers. WHO urges researchers, scientists and the media to be
cautious about amplifying unproven claims that tobacco or nicotine could reduce the risk of COVID-19.
